text: Channing Ward (born September 17, 1992) is an American football defensive tackle who is a free agent. He played college football at Mississippi. ==Professional career== Ward signed with the Buccaneers as an undrafted free agent in 2016. He made the Buccaneers' initial 53-man roster, playing in five games with one start over nine weeks and recording five tackles before being released on November 16, 2016. He was re-signed to the practice squad the next day. He was promoted back to the active roster on December 29, 2016. On September 5, 2017, Ward was waived by the Buccaneers and was re-signed to the practice squad on September 14. He was promoted to the active roster on December 20, 2017. On July 25, 2018, Ward was waived by the Buccaneers with a non-football injury designation after suffering a torn patellar tendon. He was released on September 19, 2018. In October 2019, Ward was drafted by the St. Louis BattleHawks in the 2020 XFL Draft. He had his contract terminated when the league suspended operations on April 10, 2020. ==References== ==External links== *Tampa Bay Buccaneers bio *Ole Miss Rebels bio Category:1992 births Category:Living people Category:People from Aberdeen, Mississippi Category:Players of American football from Mississippi Category:American football defensive ends Category:Ole Miss Rebels football players Category:Tampa Bay Buccaneers players Category:St. Louis BattleHawks players
title: Channing Ward
